body.name: Sinful Crown: An Enemies-to-Lovers Romance (The Corrupt Empire)
body.description: From USA Today bestselling author Ava Harrison comes a new standalone enemies-to-lovers romance about a villain and the woman he vows to protect. My protector is a monster. Evil men are searching for me.Gideon Byrne is my salvation.Cold. Cruel. And handsome beyond measure.He should scare me.His possessive desire should make me run.But I stay.I give in to him.I give him… me.I’m falling in love with a monster.And I refuse to stop.Gideon Byrne is many things.Predator. Enemy.Protector. Lover.Only one question remains…Is he my villain or my savior?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Obsession, Ava Harrison style
reviews.reviewText: Ava Harrison takes us back to the dark side in Sinful Crown, a Mafia romance. Harrison grabs your attention in the opening sentences and doesn't let you go until the very last moment. This decadent walk in her mafia world is just perfect. Gideon Byrne is at the top of his world. A hard-nosed businessman, feared drug lord, he isn't a man to cross. He reluctantly grants a man's dying wish to protect his sister, and comes to find more trouble than he bargained for. Sasha Lennox is a young woman used to disappointment. Her older brother is a drug addict and not above stealing her meager savings. Learning of his death sends her reeling. Meeting Gabriel Byrne knocks her out of orbit. Gideon is obsessed with Sarah, and kidnaps her to thwart a death threat brought on by the actions of her brother. Sarah just wants to go home, and she's not afraid to let Gideon know exactly what she thinks of him, his kidnapping of her, and his less than savory business practices. It's a race against an unknown threat and Sarah finally finding a way to escape. Their love story is steamy, and filled with twists and turns. We've come to expect nothing less from Ava Harrison, and she delivers. This Mafia world is one we've visited before, and characters from others books make an appearance. I just want to say, Mafia-Men group texts are a thing, and not to be missed. Que up some Yo-Yo Ma or Hauser cello pieces, and settle back to enjoy Sinful Crown. You'll never find classical cello boring again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great ending of the series
reviews.reviewText: Well written, exciting story! Liked the ending and the twist! Gideon was a good anti hero. Loved the banter in the chat with all the gang from the other books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I Love this Story... Sinful Crown...Hmm
reviews.reviewText: This story was full of twists and turns, lies and betrayal but it was oh so good, as only Ava Harrison can do. This is the story of Gideon Byrne and Sasha Lennox. We know that Gideon took over after Tobias stepped down to be with his wife. This was another successful story of a wealthy man who is good and bad. Gideon gets the women but he had to save her from the Russian Mafia but wait until you find out the twist in the plot. I enjoyed this book 📚📖 very much. I would highly recommend this Ava Harrison book, but then I would highly recommend any of her books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Like the author, just not big on this book
reviews.reviewText: Well, it wasnt terrible, but not good either.Gideon has an immediate obsession with Sasha. Kindof unbelievable really, but hey, when lust at first sight strikes! Who am I to say anything.I just had issues with holes in the story and a lack of realty and chemistry.I definitely did NOT feel their love when they started flinging the L word around. I thought Sasha was stupid when going back to her apt in the end. Gideon "teaching" Sasha to shoot a gun was ridiculous. "Shoot at this and aim" but no ear protection? This alone would freak a virgin to shooting out. Not to mention, the author made no mention of it. Just shooting along at targets, yet not once was..."ouch, I have ringing in my ears!"...brought up. Because you would! What happened to the Russian that helped Sasha? What exactly did Gideon do? Drug dealer? He was always working but nothing explained. What's that Elysian deal we never heard about after he met the main seller? Just so many loose ends. At about 75% of the book, I started to trudge along slowly. I had a very hard time finishing the book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Jacob Morgan and Stella Hunter did this book right
reviews.reviewText: Jacob Morgan and Stella Hunter...say less. This book was so good and I love Ava Harrison's work. The dual narration of this mafia standalone with the strong fmc was an easy read. I loved it and I will reread it because I still think about this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Gideon isn’t someone you should like because in his world things can go bad and it can get you killed. He makes a promise to a dying friend to protect his sister Sasha, but he doesn’t know from who or why. Sasha is a hard worker trying to save as much money as she can and is working up the courage to apply to Julliard even though she’s afraid to play in front of an audience. When Gideon first sees Sasha he’s not expecting her beauty and can’t keep her out of his mind. They have a chemistry that can’t be denied, but he has to earn her trust. This story has a bit of everything, banter among friends, suspense, romance, danger, and love.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars so good scary tho.
reviews.reviewText: I just found Ava Harrison and I love her books. She shows real struggle. The issue is that men put on a front but they can be really loving and devoted. Great story!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is the story of Gideon, a mob boss, and Sasha, a poor cellist who has dreams of Julliard. She’s been kidnapped by Gideon to keep her safe. But will her heart be safe from him? Ava Harrison never disappoints. Her books are always fabulous.
Good! I really enjoyed. I love the whole OTT and J/P TYPE OF GUY, specially if the girl knock him down a peg! I love these kind of books

A remarkably gripping, entertaining and passionate book. Gideon and Sasha are highly engaging, alluring and interesting characters with an enticing, intriguing and captivating storyline. From the very first chapter I was all in! This mafia romance has danger, suspense and drama. The chemistry between Gideon and Sasha is intense and breathtaking. Even if Gideon is a criminal he has many redeeming qualities and his devotion to Sasha is just beautiful. I enjoyed Sasha’s character because of her sassiness and strength , also it was delightful to see how Gideon never expected that she’d be everything he ever needed.Congratulations Ava this book is PHENOMENAL🙌🏻❤️🙌🏻❤️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: This was a jolly good read
reviews.reviewText: This book had the right combination of mafia style action, combined with a good love story, and of course, sexy bits.

reviews.reviewTitle: A deliciously dark romance with an obséssed MM
reviews.reviewText: Did I read this because of the Narrator (Jacob Morgan)? Yes, and I regret nothing!Gideon, the MMC, gives all the possessive "touch her, and I'll end you" vibes, and I was so here for it! His dry humor and thoughts were even better through Jacob Morgan's performance. I freaking loved being in his head!While Sasha started as a more timid, quiet girl, she quickly showed her feisty side. She knew something felt fishy and didn't let her attraction overrule her common sense. I appreciated her giving as much back as she got.I loved how slowly their relationship developed, and the tension between these two was great. I also LOVED that Gideon called her “firefly”. I have a weakness for unique pet names, and this hit that sweet spot where it didn't feel weird or too basic.While the beginning captured me right away, the last third of the story started to drag on a little. But I'm happy with how everything ended.Overall, I really enjoyed Sinful Crown and can only recommend the audiobook. (Jacob Morgan is the best. You're so missing out if you haven't listened to an audiobook narrated by him yet.)Definitely not my last Ava Harrison book!🗂Genre: Contemporary Romance📕Type: Standalone🏷Tropes:- Mafià- Age gap- Förced proximity- Pössessive MMC- "Even just try touching her and I'll end you"- "I need to know everything about her"- "Her words are only for me"📖Audiobook: 1st person dual POV, and narration (Jacob Morgan & Stella Hunter) ++++++

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: 4⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️MafiaDrug lordKidnapCaptiveJpSaw this in a group and thought I’d give it a bash. Good read I personally would say it’s abit slow on any smut but the tension going on between them makes up for that and when it does kick in it kicks in.Love Gideon and how possessive he itHis guards aren’t even allowed to talk or lock at her or he became angry and was planning tbeir death 💀Love that’s there is also side books linked to think loved their text group chat 😂
